arlut.csd.ganymede.rmi
Interface Server

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
GanymedeServer
public interface Server
extends java.rmi.Remote

Master remote interface definition for the Ganymede Server Object.

The Ganymede Server object provides the interface that clients use to log in to the Ganymede Server.

This RMI remote interface is implemented by the first object published by the Ganymede server at system startup, and is used by clients to begin their interaction with the server.

Method Summary
 ReturnVal admin(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
          This method is used to process a Ganymede admin console attachment.

          Client login method.

          Simple RMI test method.. this method is here so that the ClientBase class can test to see whether it has truly gotten a valid RMI reference to the server.

          XML Client login method.
 

Method Detail

login

ReturnVal login(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException

Client login method. Establishes a GanymedeSession object in the server for the client, and returns a serializable ReturnVal object which will contain a Session remote reference for the client to use, if login was successful.

If login is not successful, the ReturnVal object will encode a failure condition, along with a dialog explaining the problem.

The GanymedeSession object contains all of the server's knowledge about a given client's status., and is tracked by the GanymedeServer object for statistics and for the admin console's monitoring support.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

xmlLogin

ReturnVal xmlLogin(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException

XML Client login method. Establishes a GanymedeXMLSession object in the server for the client, and returns a serializable ReturnVal object which will contain a XMLSession remote reference for the client to use, if login was successful.

If login is not successful, the ReturnVal object will encode a failure condition, along with a dialog explaining the problem.

The GanymedeXMLSession object in turn contains a GanymedeSession object, which contains all of the server's knowledge about a given client's status., and is tracked by the GanymedeServer object for statistics and for the admin console's monitoring support.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

admin

ReturnVal admin(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException

This method is used to process a Ganymede admin console attachment. The returned ReturnVal object will contain an adminSession remote reference, accessible with the getAdminSession() method if the admin connect was successful.

If the admin console connect was not successful, the reason why it failed will be encoded in a dialog definition contained in ReturnVal.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

up

boolean up()
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException

Simple RMI test method.. this method is here so that the ClientBase class can test to see whether it has truly gotten a valid RMI reference to the server.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
